input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Effective April 9, 2020 - AGASD will be CLOSED for the remainder of the school year due to the statewide order by Governor Wolf.

p.span: As a reminder, we are serving free lunch to anyone 18 years of age or younger at four locations.

span.span: Starting Monday April 20th, we will be serving meals on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday ONLY at all four locations.
Monday you will receive meals for Monday and Tuesday, Wednesday you will receive meals for Wednesday and Thursday, and Friday will be meals for Friday

span.em: This will help to limit the amount of contact our cafeteria staff is having with people.

span.strong: We will be offering meals from 11:00 am to 12:30 pm at the above locations for pick up only.
Also, we have a pick-up point at Point Marion Volunteer Fire Department.Meals can be picked up in the upper lot of the fire station.

To better plan in the preparation of these meals, we have instituted a call-in order system.If you are picking up 5 or more at a site please call 724-564-7190 extension 8113.We will need your name, the number of meals you will be picking up, and the location for your pick up.This information is needed by 9:30 am each morning.

p.span: We certainly appreciate your patience and cooperation during these times.

strong.span: ATTENTION SENIORS: If you are interested in applying for a scholarship, please visit

div.strong: During the COVID-19 crisis we will be posting information to this page as well as our District Facebook page. Please check back routinely for updated information. Stay safe!

span.style: color: #ffffff; font-family: acumin-pro, serif; text-align: center; background-color: #ff0000;font-size:16px

div.span: Effective April 9, 2020 - AGASD will be CLOSED for the remainder of the school year due to the statewide order by Governor Wolf.

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Hello AGASD Community, we hope you are all doing well as we continue on with this alternate way of life. Below is some important information regarding the coming days/week.

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Thursday, April 9th and Tuesday, April 14th are make-up days therefore are learning days - lunches will also be available as normal.

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Friday, April 10th and Monday, April 13th are holiday days therefore there is NO learning on these days - there will be NO lunch service on these days as well.

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff
font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Grades 6-12 report cards will be mailed beginning on April 17th.

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff
font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Grades K-5 report cards will be distributed during instructional packet #2 pickup on April 20th between 9:30a and 2:30p. This will be the ONLY day to pickup packets so please make every attempt to do so. Also, when picking up packet #2 you will be able to turn in packet #1 - if completed. There will be bins at each building to place them in.

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff
font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Please follow previous procedures for packet pickup as they will be the exact same.

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff
font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: We are currently in the process of transitioning to an online student registration process and are planning to begin Kindergarten registration during the first week of May. Detailed information will be posted once it is finalized.

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Please enjoy the Easter break with your families and stay safe!

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Next week (4/6-4/10) will be a theme week as we SPRING INTO ONLINE FUN!

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Monday----Crazy Sock Day

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Tuesday----Hat Day

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Wednesday---Crazy Hair Day

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Thursday---AG Day

p.style: color: #1d2129; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Friday---No School (Happy Easter)

p.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Attention Parents/Guardians:

p.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: Please be advised that all learning packets are to be kept until further notice. This is very important. We will inform you of the drop off procedures in the future.

p.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px; text-align: left
p.span: We are currently making plans for the next phase of our education plan.

div.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; text-align: left

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px
p.span: If you have not yet picked-up your childs learning packet please contact your childs school to discuss arrangements.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px
p.span: We realize certain circumstances exist and are willing to work with you.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px
p.span: Please note: We ask your help in sharing this information as we understand many families lack or have limited internet connectivity or devices. We are trying to convey updates in various ways the best we can to reach everyone. Your help and cooperation is something we know can be relied on as you have always been very supportive.

p.style: font-family: inherit; margin-bottom: 6px; margin-top: 6px
p.span: Thanks to all of you that made our first distribution quite successful. We are AG STRONG and its because of you!

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Middle/High School Parents/Students:

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Student Chromebook Repair Procedures

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Below are instructions on how we will be handling student Chromebook repairs beginning on April 7th. For the safety of parents/students, as well as our IT staff these guidelines MUST be strictly followed.

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Every Tuesday between 9:00am and 11:00am, you can drop your Chromebook off at the main entrance of the High School (1119 Township Drive). You will NOT need to get out of your car. When dropping your Chromebook off for repair, please make sure to write down your full name, grade, and description of issue on a piece of paper and place it inside of the Chromebook. *Note, your device will NOT be repaired on the same day*

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Every Thursday between 9:00am and 11:00am, you can pick up your repaired/replaced Chromebook at the SAME location (HS main entrance). Again, you will NOT need to get out of your car.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit
p.span: For any questions or concerns, please email Chris Bolin, Director of Technology at cbolin@agasd.org

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: AGASD's distance learning plan will begin tomorrow - Tuesday, March 31st.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Grades 6-12 will be online utilizing the Google Classroom platform.

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Grades K-5 will be the packet system that were distributed to parents today. Packet pickup has been extended to Thursday, April 2nd for those that were unable to make it today.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit
p.span: We are all in this together and things will be a work in progress but we genuinely appreciate your support and patience during these times.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Given todays announcement from Governor Wolf, we are currently working on future plans to continue with distance learning. We will do our best to keep you updated in a timely manner.

p.style: margin-bottom:8.0pt;text-align:left; line-height:106%

strong.span: Continuity of Education Planned Instructional Packets Grades K - 5

p.span: Date for Pick Up Monday, March 30, 2020

br.span: Location Main Entrances at All Elementary Schools

p.span: Parents / Guardians are to pull into the schools driveway and line up along the curb
DO NOT exit your vehicle
Give the name(s) of your child(ren) & grade level
Planned instructional packets will be handed to parent / guardian
Parents / Guardians may ONLY pick up packets for YOUR child(ren)
Once packets have been completed, please keep them until collection procedures have been established

span.text-node: Continuity of Education Planned Secondary (6-12) Chromebook Pickup

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Beginning on Monday, March 30th you will be allowed to pick up your childs Chromebook and/or charger if it was left in their locker or classroom.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
margin: 6px 0px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
p.span: Specific school-based instructions are as follows

div.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Please call 724-564-2024 x5310 or email

with your childs name, grade, call back number, and locker number or location of Chromebook. The device will then be retrieved by a gloved District staff member and the device will be wiped down/sanitized prior to pickup. Once devices are ready for pickup you will receive a call with a date/time.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Please call the school directly (724-737-5423) and make arrangements for pickup with the principal or secretary. The device will then be retrieved by a gloved District staff member and the device will be wiped down/sanitized prior to pickup.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit
p.span: Please call the school directly (724-725-5241) and make arrangements for pickup with the principal or secretary. The device will then be retrieved by a gloved District staff member and the device will be wiped down/sanitized prior to pickup.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: inherit

em.span: Additional questions regarding student devices can be directed to Chris Bolin, Director of Technology at

div.span:
2625 Morgantown Road
Uniontown, PA 15401
Phone: 724-564-7190
Fax: 724-564-7195
